DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Margin Proximal Distance Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a value in centimeters indicating the measured length between a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and a border of tissue removed in surgery situated nearest to the midline plane of the body.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: related to the space between a malignant lesion of the colon or the rectum and the border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery situated nearest to the midline plane of the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: Proximal; situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.:The space between two objects or points.

Concepts.definition: Situated nearest to a point of attachment or origin.
The space separating two objects or points.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value indicating the measured length or distance between a malignant lesion of the colon or rectum and a border of tissue removed during cancer surgery.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements of a patient's surgical margins.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: Move to caBIG context as teh preferred Rep class for Measurement

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Use caBIG Representation Term Measurement based on NCIt concept
